column4: So, where all the xammp programs installed by default in serer edition?
Doesn't LAMPP/XAMPP come installed in Ubuntu Server Edition, if so, where?
Doesn't LAMPP/XAMPP come installed in Ubuntu Server Edition, if so, where?
Doesn't LAMPP/XAMPP come installed in Ubuntu Server Edition, if so, where?
if you selected the option upon install, yes
LAMP is an abbreviation for Linux Apache MySQL and Php, they install in various places
try /var/www for apache as an example
you'll have to look around, honestly if you "need" LAMP, you should already know all this
no offense to you, but tons of people are obsessively installing LAMP lately, I'm not sure why as most don't have any idea what it is or why they would want it.
what made you think you needed LAMP?
ahh migrating from an existing install
that makes more sense, take a look at the startup scripts in /etc/init.d/ for apache and mysql, they should reference the install dirs
it may be /var/mysql but I'm not positive with the ubuntu packages
give me a sec, I'll find a link
sorry none of the sites I found were a good howto, lot of bad advice
take a look for /etc/my.cnf or a my.cnf in /etc/ somewhere to find the dirs for mysql
this should be quite useful for you http://www.tldp.org/LDP/intro-linux/html/chap_03.html
check that link I pasted for you before, it covers all the filesystem basics
